creator: jian.cai@sun.com
text:
This relates to the Miscellaneous features of tomcat 4.0.

Although in the conf/server.xml file, the application was declared as
reloadable, the context had not been reloaded when the class was recompiled or
touched.

I used "<DefaultContext  debug="0" crossContext="true" reloadable="true">" to
define the context as reloadable.

This feature should have been fixed since b5 (we got a number of reports on 
this). Could you try again with one of the new nightly build ?
creator: remm@apache.org
remm@apache.org
text:
Also, it's related to this bug : true context reloading (ie, stop and restart, 
which is different from a simple reload) is broken in Catalina at the moment.
The bug was confirmed to be fixed.
creator: remm@apache.org
